localString.value: A small altar rests before you. You catch your reflection in its polished gleam, feeling somehow at peace within its presence.

Favored by druids for its graceful and natural beauty, malachite is known for its strikingly ornamental bands of light and dark green that alternate throughout the entire stone. Painters have also been known to crush the gem and use it as a pigment. Adventurers have discovered that the gem bubbles and dissolves readily in acid, making it an effective - if expensive - means of identifying certain dangerous substances.
A large piece of meat has dislodged from the creature. It would not be wise to eat it. Perhaps if you cook it on a campfire it would be safe to consume.
A large piece of meat has dislodged from the creature. It would not be wise to eat it. Perhaps if you cook it on a campfire it would be safe to consume.
A small chest for storing valuables.
Flies buzz around the fetid corpse. The body is curled into a fetal position as if cold or in great pain.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of copper ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of copper ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of tinstone ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of tinstone ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of silver ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of iron ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of iron ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of gold ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of gold ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of gold ore.
A large, solid ore vein juts out from the ground. This one seems to contain traces of blue syenite.
